item.title: Using Tags to Organize the Site
item.description: Tags are tiny bits of information to organize your content and make it easier to find for users. If tags are not used correctly they can create confusion and chaos instead of order. Tags can quickly get out of hand if you don’t have a plan from the beginning. Before you start tagging posts think about the topics you will be writing about most often. Imagine you have 50-500 posts. How many tags will you need to organize these posts?

item.title: Compelling Copy
item.description: Do you ever wish that there was an easy formula for writing persuasive (web) copy? The AIDA Copywriting Formula AIDA stands for: Attention: Grab their attention Interest: Interest them with interesting facts / uses / stats Desire: Make them come to the conclusion, “I WANT THIS” Action: Tell them exactly how to buy, and what will happen next. Learn More
